metadata.title: USN-7131-1 -- Vim vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that Vim incorrectly handled memory when closing a buffer, leading to use-after-free. If a user was tricked into opening a specially crafted file, an attacker could crash the application, leading to a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7131-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  vim - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm11 vim-athena - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm11 vim-common - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm11 vim-doc - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm11 vim-gnome - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm11 vim-gtk - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm11 vim-gtk3 - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm11 vim-gui-common - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm11 vim-nox - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm11 vim-runtime - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm11 vim-tiny - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm11 xxd - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm11 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
